alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Hanover; Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 6:29PM EDT until May 27 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Louisa County in central Virginia... Southwestern Caroline County in north central Virginia... Northwestern Hanover County in central Virginia... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 628 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Montpelier, or 12 miles southeast of Mineral, moving northeast at 25 mph. In addition, a possible funnel cloud has been spotted with this storm and a Tornado Warning may be needed if the storm strengthens further. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Bumpass around 640 PM EDT. Ladysmith around 705 PM EDT. Milford around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Chilesburg, Golansville, Oliver, Coatesville, Hewlett, Mabelton, Penola, Noel, Beaverdam and Burruss Corner. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
